Posts.Content: t8ermomma wrote: I had to rescheulde my appt. I was hoping to get insurance prior to my appt, but it just didn't happen. So a few weeks later, but it's done. My dr was great. She listened and asked questions, and then listened some more before doing the exam. She did feel the lump right away. Didn't even question my sanity once! Which was very reassuring! LOL. The last couple of weeks I have been trying to talk myself into thinking it's all in my mind or it's just lymph nodes, and really talking myself out of panic. At one point right as she was starting the exam I was a little worried about her. She said that generally bc doesn't have pain. I was just about to tell her about the thread on here when she corrected herself. She said that "GENERALLY" it doesn't present with pain, but that many women do have it--but we'd focus on the positive thought. I felt so much better after her correcting her statement. I figure if she KNEW that and was willing to make sure that I knew it too-She wasn't going to sugar coat what I needed to hear and she KNEW what she was talking about. It helped calm me. She said that she is not going to take any chances and is sending me for an us and mam at the breast center. She even called them while I was in the exam room. She said that I'll qualify for a grant. And is being so helpful to get me all set up. Anyways, as an after thought she said that part of the lump feels gritty--like she would expect from a cyst. But it's not all gritty. (I can't even feel the gritty part) So, I walked in to my house, looked at my husband and said--it's NOT lymph nodes. And then broke down. I don't think it sunk in until then. So now that we are thinking and not just reacting, we are saying--it's just a cyst. It's just a cyst. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Finally Had my Breast Exam! t8ermomma EmD

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2013 12:00AM t8ermomma wrote: Thanks everyone! I'm sitting on pins and needles. I did qualify for the grant, I just have to quit playing telephone tag with the scheuler to get a mam and us set up. I am really OVER this hurry up and wait thing and I just started! I don't think I'm going to do very well on that end. But it's going as fast as it can right now.
Posts.Title: Finally Had my Breast Exam! t8ermomma EmD

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2013 11:15AM t8ermomma wrote: Well, I finally caught the scheduler!! Apparently my order said stat and they are double booking me for monday! And she told me to stay flexible for the Radiologist. That is much sooner than I had anticipated!! And a little frightening since they are shoving me in so quickly. Don't get me wrong. I am thankful that the wait will be shorter, but wow, that just kind of blows my mind that it's happening so fast. I'm used to dr's saying "we can't fit you in for 4-6 weeks!" Now to stay calm and collected until then!
Posts.Title: Finally Had my Breast Exam! t8ermomma EmD

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2013 12:17AM t8ermomma wrote: EmD, I hope they figure your lump out soon. I am going nuts with this. I can only imagine what I'll be like if they come back and say--yup it's there, but don't know why! really and truly, the waiting is the pitts. Fenella, I can imagine that would be a nightmare. It must be so uncomfortable having so many cysts. I know my lump is a pain. LITERALLY! and it keeps pressing on my arm and I lose feeling in my hand. Which is why I was convincing myself that I just had swollen lymph nodes. Hmm, apparently not. I am staying away from google--well as much as I can. A friend mentioned that it sounded weird that it was gritty feeling and the dr said like a cyst--she (my friend) had read that cysts were smooth--so I did go look at that. And almost every website that I looked at it does say they are smooth. So I don't know what that means other than--I'm not going to freak out and I'll wait for the tests . . . . Or I'll try to wait!!
Posts.Title: Finally Had my Breast Exam! t8ermomma EmD

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2012 06:13PM t8ermomma wrote: One thing I did was to call around. I couldn't be seen by one Dr. Until the middle of Jan. And another until the middle of March. So I kept calling around. And make sure you tell them that this is a lump issue and not a routine appt. That is what finally opened up someone's schedule. And trust me. I am define itely staying away from Dr. Google. He's just a fearmonger!! LOL!

Though our symptoms are vastly different, I think you are doing the right thing. Getting things checked will either bring you piece of mind or put you in a position to get healthy. I hope you can get in quickly. My appt is on Friday. This may be a very long week for me. :)

And though I am staying away from Dr. Google, The honest to goodness-and very obvious possible result--keeps shoving it's ugly name in my mind.
Posts.Title: Changes concerned! Prncsscharli Prncsscharli

Posts.Content: t8ermomma wrote: last week I had my appt for my mammogram. It started out really confusing. The tech looked over my previous mammogram and ultrasound and the dr's order. She left me there and went to talk to the radiologist. because I am young the radiologist didn't want to do another mammogram. My previous mammogram was normal with fibrocystic changes on ultrasound. She felt it was better to start with the ultrasound and skip the mammogram unless they found some changes. my original lump had not changed any. it was fine, but. . . isn't there always a but? she found what looks like a cyst but has blood flow. in her words "you just bought yourself a mammogram".  sigh, the mammogram showed nothing. the breast tissue is too dense. which I find very humorous since I have wussy boobs after 4 kids. anyways, she says there isn't anything to do at this point but wait. there is no lump at the site to even do a biopsy. so 6 months of waiting and checking for a lump monthly.  Yes, this should be close to fun!! ugh.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: have results, new concerns t8ermomma t8ermomma

Posts.Content: t8ermomma wrote: Jan 2013 I had my first mammogram for a lump I had found during a self exam and it turned out to be Fibrocystic Changes, they wanted a biopsy and a return in 6 mos. I didn't have the money for the biopsy and life happend and I didn't go in for the 6 mon check. I know, probably not the best choice, but it is what it is. Wednesday, I had my annual check with a different dr. I found last spring that I really like (first full check in 7 years due to no insurance and other causes that made it strategically/logistically impossible). Dr originally said he wasn't concerned that I didn't go back and that he wasn't a big pusher of Mammograms in the first place. He tends to lean toward not having them until 60 unless there is a reason to (such as family history, lumps, etc). So, as I'll be 38 next week--he didn't seem concerned. Even with the Fibrocystic changes. He was blaming it on Caffeine. LOL AND THEN WE DID THE EXAM! He found one small one on the right breast. Totally new that I hadn't found. He was still confident that it wasn't a big deal as it felt like a cyst. the left hand side though was so large (much larger than it was last year) that he could put his fingers on both sides and moved the mass around. It wasn't tetherred down or anything, so he still is leaning toward fibrocystic changes, but it was harder and larger than expected. And he decided immediately that we need a mammogram asap. His rapid change in concern is what has me concerned. After my initial panic for 2 days, I'm now feeling like it's still just Fibrocystic changes. It's movable, it has some changes during the month--but it is larger, it is harder, and so I see his concern. And wondering if I am just burying my head in the sand. Finally told my mom (she's my step-mom, but her mother died from breast cancer so I didn't want to mention it before until I really knew something for sure--but if this is going to stick around and bite my patutti ever year, I figured I'd give her a heads up) and she is convinced there is no danger. And is adamant that if they want a biopsy I should refuse because her dr told her that if they do a biopsy and it isn't cancerous, it will be in a few years (sounds cockeyed to me, but she has had several of her patients come back with biopsied "clear" cysts turning cancerous later on) We don't know my family medical history for anything on either side. So it's just a big question mark. Mammogram is scheduled for Tuesday.  If they want it biopsied, should I? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Back again . . . t8ermomma MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: t8ermomma wrote: It's past time to go in for my 3rd  mammogram. I've been  on a every 6 month schedule  and it's about 8 months since my last check. The last one they found via ultrasound, was a possible cyst with blood flow  that had them concerned but the couldn't feel it nor see it on the mammo. So they sent me on my way.  Ive paid attention like they told me to and i think there is a new lump but im not sure. I've had pain since day  one of my first lump and so that doesn't really worry me. Until today. Today I had a sharp stab right where the new lump is and it was so sharp and unexpected  that it took my breath away. Nothing like the full on ache that I've been  dealing  with  for two years-so much worse. It lasted maybe  a minute  and now I've got that constant ache ive had forever and a new stinging sensation that has my nerves  on edge.   Is this a new symptom or just my brain telling my rear to get in gear to check things out? I'd be perfectly  happy to hear "your mind is playing  tricks  on you!" Birads  is 3 so they won't biopsy at this  point .   Log in to post a reply
